key_title: Key to the species of Rumex

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Polygonaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Polygonaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Polygonaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Valves entire
Valves with marginal teeth or spines
Panicle open with divaricate branches, flower 'whorls' distant and nearly all subtended by a leaf; valves small and with a thick callosity covering most of their surface
Panicle condensed, flower 'whorls' almost contiguous, only the lowermost or none subtended by a leaf; callosity not covering most of valve surface
Stem erect, with more less appressed inflorescence branches; leaves lanceolate, acute, margins usually strongly crisped
Stem procumbent with a few short, erect or ascending inflorescence branches; leaves thick, leathery when dry, obovate, with plane margins; probably not in Victoria, see note in genus profile
Annuals; fruiting valves to 2 mm long, each with a large dorsal callosity; leaves more or less linear with cordate lobes at base, margin usually strongly crisped
Perennials; fruiting valves longer than 2 mm, with or without dorsal callosities; leaves various
Aquatic or semi-aquatic plants with stems creeping on mud, or internodes inflated and floating on water surface; leaves all cauline; inflorescence relatively short, simple or few-branched
Terrestrial plants (but often growing in poorly-drained sites), stems erect; leaves all basal or basal and cauline (sometimes absent at maturity); inflorescence usually many-branched
Fruiting valves with 3–5 hooked teeth along each side and 1 at the apex; outer perianth segments also with hooked apices
Fruiting valves with 1–several straight or slightly curved (but never hooked) teeth along each side; outer perianth segments never hooked
Basal leaves oblong-ovate or elliptic, about twice as long as broad, base distinctly cordate
Leaves lanceolate to linear, many times longer than broad, base variable
Pedicels slender, c. 2–3 times as long as fruiting valves, articulated well below midway; inflorescence with more or less erect branches; fruiting valves usually 2- or 3-toothed
Pedicels thickish, about as long as the fruiting valves, articulated near midway; inflorescence branches divaricate; fruiting valves usually with 4–6 teeth
Leaves very narrow, c. 5 mm broad, up to 20 times longer than broad, flat; fruiting valves 2.5–3 mm long
Leaves broader than 5 mm, margins usually distinctly crisped; valves 3–6 mm long; mature inflorescence divaricately branched, breaking off as base and dispersed as a tumbleweed
Valves triangular, 2- or 3-toothed
Valves oblong or narrowly triangular, with long-acuminate apex, 1 (rarely 2)- toothed
